metadata.description: Reference information and clinical guidelines with comprehensive source citations

content.overview: Angles klassifikation, introducerad av Edward Angle 1899, är det mest använda systemet för att klassificera malokklusioner baserat på förhållandet mellan första permanenta molarerna. Trots att den är över 120 år gammal används den fortfarande universellt i ortodonti.

class_I.definition: Mesiobuccal cusp av övre första molaren occluderar i buccal groove av nedre första molaren
characteristics: Normal anteroposterior relationship av maxilla och mandibel
Malokklusion kan förekomma i form av trängsel, spacing, crossbite, open bite, etc.
Den vanligaste typen av malokklusion i de flesta populationer
class_I.treatment: Varierar beroende på specifik malokklusion: trängsel, spacing, vertikala problem, etc.

class_II.definition: Mesiobuccal cusp av övre första molaren occluderar mesial till buccal groove av nedre första molaren

division_1.description: Klass II med proclination av överkäks-incisiver

division_2.description: Klass II med retroclination av överkäks-incisiver

etiology.skeletal: Retrognathic mandible (vanligast), prognathic maxilla, eller kombination
etiology.dental: Mesial drift av maxillary molars, distal position av mandibular molars
etiology.functional: Mouth breathing, tongue posture, lip incompetence

treatment_options: Mandibular advancement surgery (vuxna med severe skeletal discrepancy)

class_III.definition: Mesiobuccal cusp av övre första molaren occluderar distal till buccal groove av nedre första molaren
class_III.prevalence: 3-5% i kaukasiska populationer, 10-15% i asiatiska populationer

etiology.skeletal: Prognathic mandible (vanligast), retrognathic maxilla, eller kombination
etiology.dental: Lingual inclination av maxillary incisors, labial inclination av mandibular incisors

class_III.prognosis: Svårare att behandla än Klass II, särskilt med mandibulär prognathism. Kirurgi ofta nödvändig för severe skeletal cases hos vuxna.

content.limitations:
Angles klassifikation fokuserar endast på molar relationship i sagittal plane. Den tar inte hänsyn till:
- Vertikala problem (open bite, deep bite)
- Transversella problem (crossbite, midline deviation)
- Dental crowding/spacing
- Skeletal vs dental components
- Soft tissue considerations
content.modern_additions:
Moderna klassifikationssystem kompletterar Angle med:
- Skeletal classification (ANB angle, Wits appraisal)
- Vertical dimension analysis (FMA, mandibular plane angle)
- Soft tissue analysis
- Functional considerations

sources.relevance: Comprehensive coverage of Angle's classification and modern orthodontic diagnosis
sources.specificFindings: Angle's classification remains relevant but must be supplemented with skeletal and soft tissue analysis for comprehensive diagnosis
Class II Division 1: 15-20% prevalence, Class II Division 2: 3-5% prevalence, Class III: 3-5% in Caucasians, 10-15% in Asians

sources.relevance: Treatment approaches for different Angle classifications
sources.specificFindings: Treatment success varies by classification: Class I most predictable, Class III most challenging especially with mandibular prognathism

topics.title: Lateral Cephalometrisk Analys - Viktiga Landmärken och Mätningar
topics.titleEnglish: Lateral Cephalometric Analysis - Key Landmarks and Measurements

content.overview: Lateral cephalometrisk radiografi är ett standardiserat verktyg för att utvärdera craniofacial relationer i ortodonti. Introducerad 1931 av Broadbent, möjliggör den objektiv bedömning av skeletal och dental relationer.

skeletal.N_Nasion: Mest anterior punkt på nasofrontal suture
skeletal.A_Point: Deepest point på anterior contour av maxilla mellan ANS och alveolar crest
skeletal.B_Point: Deepest point på anterior contour av mandibular symphysis
skeletal.Pg_Pogonion: Mest anterior punkt på mandibular symphysis
skeletal.Gn_Gnathion: Mest anterior-inferior punkt på mandibular symphysis
skeletal.Me_Menton: Mest inferior punkt på mandibular symphysis
skeletal.Go_Gonion: Mest posterior-inferior punkt på mandibular angle
skeletal.Or_Orbitale: Mest inferior punkt på orbital margin
skeletal.Po_Porion: Mest superior punkt på external auditory meatus

SNA.description: Angle mellan S-N-A, mäter anteroposterior position av maxilla

interpretation.increased: Prognathic maxilla eller anterior positioned maxilla
interpretation.decreased: Retrognathic maxilla eller posterior positioned maxilla

SNB.description: Angle mellan S-N-B, mäter anteroposterior position av mandibel

ANB.description: Difference mellan SNA och SNB, visar skeletal relationship mellan maxilla och mandibel

interpretation.greater_than_4: Skeletal Class II (ex: ANB 7° indikerar skeletal Class II)
interpretation.less_than_0: Skeletal Class III (ex: ANB -2° indikerar skeletal Class III)

ANB.limitations: Påverkas av position av Nasion och rotation av käkar. Wits appraisal kan ge kompletterande information.

Wits_appraisal.description: Linear measurement av punkt A och B perpendicular projections till occlusal plane
Wits_appraisal.advantages: Inte påverkad av cranial base variationer, mer direkt mätning av maxillo-mandibular relationship

SN_GoGn.description: Angle mellan SN plane och mandibular plane (Go-Gn)

interpretation.increased: Vertical growth pattern, long face, open bite tendency
interpretation.decreased: Horizontal growth pattern, short face, deep bite tendency

Y_axis.description: Angle mellan S-Gn och Frankfort horizontal
Y_axis.interpretation: Indicates growth direction: anterior (decreased) vs posterior (increased) rotation

U1_SN.description: Angle mellan maxillary incisor long axis och SN plane

IMPA.description: Incisor Mandibular Plane Angle - angle mellan mandibular incisor long axis och mandibular plane

Interincisal_angle.description: Angle mellan maxillary och mandibular incisor long axes

treatment_planning: Plan orthognathic surgery (skeletal discrepancies >6-8mm often require surgery)
progress_evaluation: Assess skeletal changes (especially in growing patients)

digital_cephalometrics.CBCT: 3D cephalometric analysis möjlig med CBCT men högre strålning. Reserverad för komplexa fall eller surgical planning.

sources.specificFindings: Standard norms for all major cephalometric measurements with population variations. Digital cephalometrics shows 95% agreement with manual tracing.
ANB limitations discussed. Wits appraisal recommended as supplement. Skeletal discrepancies >8mm typically require surgical correction in adults.

sources.relevance: Digital cephalometric analysis and AI applications
sources.specificFindings: AI-assisted landmark detection shows 1.5mm average accuracy, comparable to experienced clinicians. Reduces analysis time by 70%.

topics.title: Principer för Tandförflyttning - Biologiska och Mekaniska Aspekter
topics.titleEnglish: Principles of Tooth Movement - Biological and Mechanical Aspects

content.overview: Ortodontisk tandförflyttning baseras på kroppens förmåga att omforma alveolär ben som respons på mekaniska krafter. Förståelse av de biologiska processerna är essential för effektiv och säker behandling.

pressure_side.process: Kompression av periodontal ligament → hypoxia → RANKL upregulation → osteoclast activation → bone resorption
pressure_side.timeline: Initial compression (seconds) → Cell signaling (hours) → Osteoclast differentiation (2-3 days) → Active resorption (5-7 days)
pressure_side.hyalinization: Vid excess force (>150-200g): cell death → hyaline zones → undermining resorption → delayed movement (2-4 veckor)

tension_side.process: Stretching av periodontal ligament → osteoblast activation → bone formation
tension_side.timeline: Fiber stretching (immediate) → Osteoblast differentiation (2-3 days) → Bone formation (7-14 days)
tension_side.new_bone: Woven bone initially → remodels to lamellar bone över månader

cellular_response.mechanotransduction: Mechanical force → cell deformation → intracellular signaling cascades
cellular_response.inflammation: Aseptic inflammation nödvändigt för tooth movement. NSAIDs kan inhibera movement men clinical significance debatterad.

tipping.description: Rotation around center of resistance (approximately 1/3 from apex)
tipping.characteristics: Crown moves mer än root. Controlled tipping har light root movement i samma riktning.

bodily_translation.description: Crown och root moves samma amount i samma direction
bodily_translation.force_required: Moderate to high (70-120g för incisors, 150-200g för molars)
bodily_translation.requirements: Force måste passera through center of resistance ELLER moment applied to counteract tipping
bodily_translation.clinical_use: Space closure, extraction site closure, precise positioning

rotation.challenges: High relapse risk pga supracrestal fiber memory. Round-rooted teeth (canines, premolars) svårare.
rotation.clinical_pearls: Overcorrection recommended (10-20°). Permanent retention often needed. Circumferential supracrestal fibrotomy can reduce relapse.

extrusion.description: Moving tooth occlusally out of socket
extrusion.characteristics: Easiest movement biologically. Risk för gingival följer tooth.

intrusion.characteristics: Most difficult movement. High risk för root resorption med excess force. Requires continuous light force.
intrusion.clinical_use: Deep bite correction, open bite correction (posterior intrusion med TADs)
intrusion.risks: Root resorption, ankylosis om force excessive (>25-30g)
intrusion.modern_approach: TADs preferred för posterior intrusion (kan tolerera higher forces 150-200g)

torque.characteristics: Moves root while maintaining crown position
torque.clinical_use: Correcting root angulation, achieving proper incisor inclination

optimal_force.light_continuous: Producerar snabbast movement med minimal damage. Ideal force: 70-120g för single-rooted teeth, 150-200g för multi-rooted.
optimal_force.heavy_intermittent: Ger hyalinization, delayed movement, mer root resorption risk
optimal_force.duration: Continuous force preferred. Removable appliances ger intermittent force (mindre efficient).

factors_affecting: Age: Snabbare i younger patients (ökad cell turnover)
Bone density: Långsammare i dense bone (Type I bone)
Force magnitude: Optimal force ger snabbast movement
Tooth type: Single-rooted snabbare än multi-rooted
Systemic factors: Medications (bisphosphonates inhibit), vitamin D levels, hormones

root_resorption.prevalence: 90% av orthodontic patients har någon degree (oftast minor <2mm)
risk_factors: Root morphology (pipette-shaped, short roots higher risk)
root_resorption.prevention: Optimal light forces, monitor radiographically, pause treatment om severe

loss_of_alveolar_bone.cause: Excessive force, poor oral hygiene, pre-existing periodontal disease
loss_of_alveolar_bone.prevention: Light forces, excellent OH, periodontal maintenance

pain_and_discomfort.timing: Peaks 24-48 hours efter force application, resolves inom 3-5 dagar
pain_and_discomfort.management: Acetaminophen preferred (NSAIDs theoretically kan inhibit movement men clinical effect minimal)
pain_and_discomfort.explanation: Inflammatory mediators (PGE2, substance P) → nociceptor activation

ankylosis.description: Fusion av root till alveolar bone
ankylosis.risk: Trauma history, excessive intrusive force, extended retention
ankylosis.signs: High metallic sound on percussion, no mobility, infraocclusion över tid

clinical_pearls: Light continuous forces optimal - 'Light wires early, heavy wires late'
Monitor root resorption radiographically midtreatment (12-18 månader)
Intrusion kräver lightest forces - consider TADs för posterior intrusion
Pause treatment if severe root resorption detected (>4mm)
Rotationer require overcorrection och prolonged retention
Biologisk respons varierar mellan patienter - individualize force levels

sources.relevance: Comprehensive review of biological mechanisms of tooth movement
sources.specificFindings: RANKL/OPG ratio critical for osteoclast regulation. Mechanotransduction involves multiple signaling pathways (MAPK, Wnt, etc.). NSAIDs show minimal clinical effect on tooth movement rate despite theoretical concerns.
Optimal force magnitudes established through decades of research. Intrusive forces must be <20-25g to prevent root resorption. Average tooth movement rate 1mm/month with optimal forces.
Root resorption occurs in 90% of cases but typically minor (<2mm). Severe resorption (>4mm) rare but requires treatment pause.
